217: Location: Albany, NY Category: Administrative Posted On: Mon Aug 22 2022 Job Description: Job responsibilities include, but are not limited to: The Grant and Contract Administrator will provide financial administration of awarded grants and corporate sponsored programs, and support for grants and contracts received by the Research Foundation for SUNY at SUNY Polytechnic Institute. Duties include, but are not limited to: becoming familiar with the portfolio of SUNY Poly sponsored programs; manage a portfolio of sponsored program awards and support those in collaboration with Investigators by providing review and financial approval of expenditure requests; monitoring and facilitating processing of cost share requirements and expenditure request transactions; insure accurate allocation of labor distribution; ; assist in coordination of account closeout processes; preparation of reports for sponsors; serve as liaison with SUNY Poly finance and sponsored program staff; monitoring budgets; regular communication with finance and sponsored program staff regarding status of grants and contracts; preparation of audit materials; working closely with staff to provide financial analysis for sponsored funds programs, corporate partnership programs, and service and facility centers; and other reasonable duties as assigned. The position will utilize ORACLE financial software to prepare financial reports, develop cost recovery models to ensure project costs are recovered. This position will also create and maintain databases to support CNSE's various reporting needs including expenditure analysis, sponsor financial reports, and personnel related statistics. Other reasonable duties as assigned. Job Requirements: Bachelor's degree in business or related field from college or University accredited by the US Department of Education or internationally recognized accrediting organization and two years' experience in a similar position. Candidate must possess the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast paced environment, have strong organization and communication skills, and display the ability and willingness to make independent decisions. Candidate must have experience with Microsoft Office or an equivalent software suite. Candidates must address in their applications their ability to work with culturally diverse populations. This position is contingent on the satisfactory completion of a background check; this position may require annual background checks. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Experience in higher education and grants and contracts management. Additional Information: Research Foundation for SUNY Polytechnic Institute offers exceptional benefits such as healthcare, dental, vision, pension plans, competitive pay, generous paid time off, tuition assistance, life insurance and long-term disability insurance.
